flow.title: CHAP-V: A Comprehensive Carbon Reduction Platform

list.title: Rapid Deployment
beforeList: Vehicle data relies on OBD-II, which varies greatly among different vehicle models, resulting in lengthy initial setup.
OBD-II connections to vehicle computers carry the risk of vehicle malfunctions.
afterList: Instant use with in-vehicle installation; combined with GIS geographic information, it computes vehicle driving behavior in real-time.
Even without in-vehicle installation, CHAP-V can be deployed via mobile, facilitating agile fleet carbon management solutions.

list.title: High Adaptability
beforeList: Different vehicle models have different OBD-II data formats, often leading to data translation issues and data omissions.
afterList: Deployment is possible for various vehicle models without integrating OBD-II systems, allowing for vehicle behavior analysis.
If vehicles are already equipped with in-vehicle devices, existing data can be integrated and analyzed via APIs.

list.title: SaaS Cloud Platform
beforeList: Manual collection of paper fuel receipts and employee commuting data is complex, time-consuming, and error-prone.
Complete calculation evidence is required when third-party verification is needed.
afterList: Automated data collection processes; all vehicle behavior information is stored in the cloud platform with high-grade data security.
Automatic generation of fuel consumption and carbon emission calculation results, eliminating the possibility of manual calculation errors and enhancing verification credibility.

list.title: AI Smart Interpretation
beforeList: Even with collected vehicle driving behavior data, only generic statistical charts can be generated, requiring significant manual interpretation by managers.
afterList: AI interpretation provides carbon reduction optimization suggestions to managers, saving time on manual interpretation.
Up to 35% carbon reduction potential has been observed through actual testing.
